remarks:
Lemma used to transfer a commutative law via an equivalence relation. (Contributed by NM, 29-Aug-1995.)  (Revised by David Abernethy, 4-Jun-2013.) 

---

 Lemma used to transfer a commutative law via an equivalence relation. Most uses will want ~ ecovicom instead.  (Contributed by NM, 29-Aug-1995.)  (Revised by David Abernethy, 4-Jun-2013.)
statement:
ecovcom.1 $e |- C = ( ( S X. S ) /. .~ ) $.
ecovcom.2 $e |- ( ( ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) /\ ( z e. S /\ w e. S ) ) -> ( [ <. x , y >. ] .~ .+ [ <. z , w >. ] .~ ) = [ <. D , G >. ] .~ ) $.
ecovcom.3 $e |- ( ( ( z e. S /\ w e. S ) /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) ) -> ( [ <. z , w >. ] .~ .+ [ <. x , y >. ] .~ ) = [ <. H , J >. ] .~ ) $.
ecovcom.4 $e |- D = H $.
ecovcom.5 $e |- G = J $.
ecovcom $p |- ( ( A e. C /\ B e. C ) -> ( A .+ B ) = ( B .+ A ) ) $.
$d .+ w x y z $.
$d .~ w x y z $.
$d A w x y z $.
$d B w z $.
$d C w z $.
$d S w x y z $.
